title: 140 Followers Problem - 2
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Large \lfloor \log (x) \rfloor  + \lfloor \log (y) \rfloor  + \lfloor \log (z) \rfloor = 140 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the number of positive integral solutions to above equation can be expressed in the form of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^{b}\times c^{d} \times e^{f} \times g^{h} \times i^{j}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"g"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are distinct positive primes and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"h"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"j"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive integers. Then find the value of"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a+b+c+d +e+f+g+h+i+j "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and Assumptions","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lfloor  k \rfloor "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" represents the greatest integer less than or equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the logarithm of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the base 10."}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Try its sister problem 140 Followers Problem."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is my original problem."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is from the set 140 Followers Problems."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number of solutions to this equation is equivalent to finding the coefficient of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t^{140}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the expansion,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(t^{\lfloor \log (1)\rfloor} + t^{\lfloor \log (2)\rfloor} + t^{\lfloor \log (3)\rfloor} + \ldots)^{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=(9+90t + 900t^{2} + 9000t^{3}+ \ldots)^{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=729 (1+10t + (10t)^2 + (10t)^3 + \ldots )^{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=729 \left( \dfrac{1}{1-10t} \right)^{3} \text{(Infinite G.P.)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=729 (1-10t)^{-3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=729 \left( 1+ \binom{3}{1}(10t) + \binom{4}{2}(10t)^{2} + \binom{5}{3}(10t)^{3} + \ldots \right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So the coefficient of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t^{140}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in this expansion is"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=729 \times (10)^{140} \times \binom{142}{140}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=2^{140} \times 3^{7} \times 5^{140} \times 71^{1} \times 47^{1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c+d+e+f+g+h+i+j= \boxed{417}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now the initial problem is to partition 140 in 3 numbers where any perticular number can be 0. Now this is done in 142C2=141"},{"type":"text","text":"71=3","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"47*71. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Let a solution triplet be {a,b,c} ,  then "},{"type":"text","text":"x is in the range    (10a,10a+1−1)(10^{a}, 10^{a+1}-1)(10a,10a+1−1), similarly      y is in the range (10b,10b+1−1)(10^{b}, 10^{b+1}-1)(10b,10b+1−1), 
and z is in the range(10c,10c+1−1)(10^{c}, 10^{c+1}-1)(10c,10c+1−1)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
    * Also (a+b+c=140) * "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
So the total number of Integral solutions are given by 
        "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"142C2 * (10^{a}*(10-1)*10^{b}*(10-1)*10^{c}*(10-1))"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
       "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 47*71*3*10^{140}*9^{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
       "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=2^{140}*5^{140}*3^{7}*47^{1}*73^{1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
                 The solution follows from this."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{π}{2}\tan(\dfrac{π}{2}x)= \dfrac{1}{(1-x)}-\dfrac{1}{(1+x)}+\dfrac{1}{(3-x)}-\dfrac{1}{(3+x)}+\dfrac{1}{(5-x)}-\dfrac{1}{(5+x)}+\cdots"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Differentiating respect to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for two times gives
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{π^3}{8}\sec^2(\frac{π}{2}x)\tan(\frac{π}{2}x)= \dfrac{1}{(1-x)^3}-\dfrac{1}{(1+x)^3}+\dfrac{1}{(3-x)^3}-\dfrac{1}{(3+x)^3}-\cdots"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
Take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=\dfrac{1}{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
The series becomes
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{π^3}{8}\sec^2(\dfrac{π}{6})\tan(\dfrac{π}{6})= \dfrac{3^3}{2^3}-\dfrac{3^3}{4^3}+\dfrac{3^3}{8^3}-\dfrac{3^3}{10^3}+\cdots"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{π^3}{6\sqrt{3}}×\dfrac{8}{27} = 1-\dfrac{1}{2^3}+\dfrac{1}{4^3}-\dfrac{1}{5^3}+\cdots"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1-\dfrac{1}{2^3}+\dfrac{1}{4^3}-\dfrac{1}{5^3}+\dfrac{1}{7^3}-\dfrac{1}{8^3}+\cdots= \dfrac{4π^3}{81\sqrt{3}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#20A900}\boxed{a+b=4+3=7}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For above lemma refer "},{"type":"text","text":"this","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" solution"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
